类的使用
mapelements.ErrorMsg

  • 使用ErrorMsg的程序包 
    程序包 说明
    mapelements  

    • mapelements中ErrorMsg的使用

      返回ErrorMsg的mapelements中的方法 
      限定符和类型 方法和说明
      ErrorMsg RiskMap.addConnection(java.lang.String countryNameFrom, java.lang.String countryNameTo)
      Method to add connection between two countries.
      ErrorMsg RiskMap.addContinent(java.lang.String continentName, int controlNum)
      Method to add a new continent.
      ErrorMsg RiskMap.addCountry(java.lang.String countryName, java.lang.String continentName, int coordinateX, int coordinateY)
      Method to add a new country to an existing continent.
      ErrorMsg RiskMap.changeControlNum(java.lang.String continentName, int controlNum)
      Method to change the control number of a continent.
      ErrorMsg RiskMap.checkErrors()
      Method to check whether the map has errors, often called after successfully call loadMapFile method, concerning the connectivity of whole map and each continent, also report empty continents.
      ErrorMsg RiskMap.deleteContinent(java.lang.String continentName)
      Method to delete a continent.
      ErrorMsg RiskMap.loadMapFile(java.lang.String mapFileName)
      Method to load map file data into defined data structure, get ready for further validation for errors and warnings.
      ErrorMsg RiskMap.moveCountry(java.lang.String toContinentName, java.lang.String countryName)
      Method to move a country to another continent.
      ErrorMsg RiskMap.removeConnection(java.lang.String countryNameFrom, java.lang.String countryNameTo)
      Method to remove the connection between two countries.
      ErrorMsg RiskMap.renameContinent(java.lang.String continentName, java.lang.String newName)
      Method to rename a continent.
      ErrorMsg RiskMap.renameCountry(java.lang.String countryName, java.lang.String newName)
      Method to rename a country.
      ErrorMsg RiskMap.saveToFile(java.lang.String mapFileName)
      Method to save map to a file, need to call checkErrors() and checkWarnings() firstly, failed due to file operation errors.
